required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Frequency of Parasite Infestation in Patients With Chronic Spontaneous Urticaria
clinical_study.official_title: HÃ¤ufigkeit Der Infestation Mit Parasiten Bei Patienten Mit Chronisch Spontaner Urtikaria, Eine Retrospektive Datenanalyse

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to describe the prevalence and the type of parasite in patients with a chronic spontaneous urticaria as well as to describe the associations between parasitic disease and the characteristics of the patients, for example eosinophilia.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with parasite infestation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Patients with a chronic spontaneous urticaria that were treated at the University hospital basel between the 1st of June 2019 and the 30th of September 2019
primary_outcome.description: assess number of patients with chronic spontaneous urticaria that have a parasite infestation (Analysis of stool samples by the Swiss Tropical and Public Health Institute (TPH), Basel)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Patients with a chronic spontaneous urticaria that were treated at the University hospital basel between the 1st of June 2019 and the 30th of September 2019
primary_outcome.description: subtype determination from stool samples was performed by the Swiss TPH, Basel by polymerase chain reaction (PCR)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between migration Background/ travel history of the patients and parasite infestation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients with a chronic spontaneous urticaria that were treated at the University hospital basel between the 1st of June 2019 and the 30th of September 2019
secondary_outcome.description: examine travel history and migration background of patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between gastrointestinal complaints of the patients and parasite infestation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Patients with a chronic spontaneous urticaria that were treated at the University hospital basel between the 1st of June 2019 and the 30th of September 2019

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients diagnosed with a chronic spontaneous urticaria
arm_group.description: Patients with a chronic spontaneous urticaria who were being treated at the allergology of the university hospital Basel between the 1st of June and the 30th of September

intervention.description: Tests for diagnosis of parasitic diseases
intervention.arm_group_label: Patients diagnosed with a chronic spontaneous urticaria

study_pop.textblock: Patients with a chric spontaneous urticaria who were being treated at the allergology of the university hospital Basel between the 1st of June and the 30th of September.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of a chronic spontaneous urticaria
- Age: 17 years old and up
Exclusion Criteria:
- No diagnosis of a chronic spontaneous urticaria
- Age: younger than 17 years
